Subject: [junit] java not so lazy loading
> private static class IAMSDBInstanceHolder
> {
static IAMSDB theInstance;
private static IAMSDB getInstance()
{
try
{
IAMSDBHome home = (IAMSDBHome)getInitialContext()
.lookup(getJNDIProperty("IAMSDBBean"));
theInstance = home.create();
}
catch(Exception e)
{
throw new NestedException("Failed to find IAMSDB", e);
}
}


public synchronized static IAMSDB getIAMSDB()
{
if(theInstance==null)
theInstance = getInstance();
return IAMSDBInstanceHolder.theInstance;
}


Just make the getIAMSDB() method synchronized with a null check. Unless you are in an extremely high-load environment with strict performance demands, you'll never notice a difference. Also, it allows you to properly throw a runtime (or checked) exception when home is not available.

Another solution is simply to exclude certain classes from the filewalker fileset (a custom Ant task works nicely).

Regards,

Mike
